post_text: We couldn’t be prouder of our band for earning 5th Place at the State Marching Contest! The band worked incredibly hard this season, earned straight first division ratings from all three judges at Region Marching Contest, competed against the best 1A bands in the state at the Alamodome, qualified for finals (multiple judges even ranked us first in prelims!) and had the best performance of the year in finals. This is the highest placement the Menard band has earned in school history! We’re so grateful to the students, parents, administration, and everyone who made this happen. This has been an amazing journey that we’ll never forget!

Good afternoon!

Hey guys! I’ve been looking at our schedule. As some of you know I will be commuting from junction to menard this year as well as having a morning and afternoon route. That will not change much for summer band but may end up influencing a few time changes when the school year begins.

I ask that you just be open minded when it comes to some changes. I will try not to make it too complicated. If anything, times may be trimmed or moved up a few minutes. However, I will NOT do anything that would potentially hinder the outcome of this years success.

With that being said, I would like to make an adjustment to the marching band schedule. All students will need to be in attendance on August 2nd at 8am! Please DO NOT show up July 31st or Aug. 1!

Enjoy the extra time off. Remember that hard work, dedication, disciple and positivity all feed into success. I’ve never gained anything without the four words mentioned above!

I’ll be in the band hall this week. I could use some smiling faces in my life 😊

Much love!
Ms. Gold

Thank you guys for supporting the band and I hope you are seeing how much they improve week to week!!

Thank you for all you do,
Gold

Annual Spring Band Concert and Dinner

The Menard Band Boosters would like to invite the community to attend the annual Menard Band Spring Concert and Dinner. This event will be held Monday, May 15th. Festivities will begin with dinner being served at the Community Center from 5:15-6:45. Lazy Ladle is preparing the pasta dinner to include: baked pasta, salad, bread, tea/water and cheesecake for dessert for a $10 donation to the band boosters. The concert featuring the High School band as well as the 5th and 6th grade bands will begin at 7 pm and will be held in the Menard High School Auditorium.

Advanced tickets may be purchased from High School Band members or at the following locations:
Menard Agrilife Extension Office (2nd floor of Courthouse)
Menard Elementary School Office
